Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Pontificate \Pon*tif"i*cate\, n. [L. pontificatus: cf. F. pontificat. See {Pontiff}.] 1. The state or dignity of a high priest; specifically, the office of the pope. --Addison. [1913 Webster]
2. The term of office of a pontiff. --Milman. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Pontificate \Pon*tif"i*cate\, v. i. (R. C. Ch.) To perform the duty of a pontiff. [1913 Webster]
pontificate n : the government of the Roman Catholic Church [syn: {papacy}] v 1: administer a pontifical office 2: talk in a dogmatic and pompous manner; "The new professor always pontificates"
